thread.title: Prince Philip, 96, leaves hospital after hip surgery

title: Prince Philip, 96, leaves hospital after hip surgery
text:
April 13, 2018 / 11:20 AM / Updated an hour ago Prince Philip, 96, leaves hospital after hip surgery Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
LONDON (Reuters) - Britain’s Prince Philip, 96, the husband of Queen Elizabeth, left hospital on Friday after a hip replacement operation, waving to media waiting outside the hospital as he was driven away. Britain's Prince Philip waves as he is driven away from King Edward VII's Hospital where he recently underwent hip replacement surgery, in central London, April 13, 2018. REUTERS/Peter Summers 
Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh, was admitted last week to the King Edward VII Hospital in London which is regularly used by the royal family. 
Former naval officer Philip retired from public life last August, quipping at the time that he was no longer able to “stand up much”. Slideshow (4 Images) 
“His Royal Highness The Duke of Edinburgh left King Edward VII’s Hospital at midday today, following a hip replacement operation last week. The Duke will continue his recovery at Windsor,” Buckingham Palace said in a statement. 
“His Royal Highness would like to convey his appreciation for the messages of good wishes he has received,” it added. Reporting by Costas Pitas; editing by Stephen Addison
